result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Thomas Bouchard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court waived all mandatory and non-mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Thomas Bouchard

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements, filed.

Defendant Edward Thomas Bouchard in court with attorney Kirk D Henley. Defendant Edward Thomas Bouchard in custody. Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1 and 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 3: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, Victim JEB, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 3:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 96 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 96 DAYS time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

-Court waived all MANDATORY AND NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Attorney Kirk D Henley in court, defendant Edward Thomas Bouchard not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  
Final Pretrial held. Court holds colloquy with parties.  Case remains in trial posture.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 05/11/2022 at 09:00am, Branch 30.
Received and Filed. State's Motion to Join
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. EXP. 05/31/2022

Attorney Kirk D Henley in court, defendant Edward Thomas Bouchard not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 30.   This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Kirk D Henley in court, defendant Edward Thomas Bouchard not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Status Conference. Discussion held. Defendant has a pending matter  (21CM2889) before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with JEB
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Edward Thomas Bouchard in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Edward Thomas Bouchard in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward Thomas Bouchard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Case reassigned due to same alleged victim in lower pending case before Judge Richards.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Status conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
